required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: the Efficacy and Safety of Anlotinib Combined With Almonertinib in the First-line Treatment of Patients With Brain Metastases From EGFR Mutation-positive Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Clinical Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Anlotinib Combined With Almonertinib in the First-line Treatment of Patients With Brain Metastases From EGFR Mutation-positive Non-small Cell Lung cancer-----a Prospective, Single-arm Exploratory Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Subject population：Patients with brain metastases from EGFR mutation-positive non-small cell lung cancer who have not received systemic treatment.
Experimental design: Single-center, single-arm phase II clinical trial. Purpose: Efficacy and safety of Anlotinib combined with Almonertinib in the treatment of patients with brain metastases from EGFR mutation-positive non-small cell lung cancer.
treatment plan: 1). Anlotinib: 12mg/time (BSA≥1.6 m2) or 10mg/time (BSA<1.6 m2), once a day orally, taking two weeks and stopping for one week; 2). Almonertinib: 110mg, orally once a day; primary endpoint: Intracranial progression-free survival (iPFS); secondary endpoint: Objective intracranial response rate (iORR=iCR+iPR), intracranial disease control rate (iDCR=iCR+iPR+i SD), overall progression-free survival (PFS), overall survival (OS), quality of life score.

arm_group.description: Anlotinib (12mg/time (BSA≥1.6 m2) or 10mg/time (BSA<1.6 m2), once a day orally, taking two weeks and stopping for one week) combine with Almonertinib (110mg, orally once a day)

intervention.description: Anlotinib: 12mg/time (BSA≥1.6 m2) or 10mg/time (BSA<1.6 m2), once a day orally, taking two weeks and stopping for one week; Almonertinib: 110mg, orally once a day;
